To get a more accurate comparison, one must start with the number of directly confirmed flu deaths, which the CDC tracks on an annual basis. In the past seven flu seasons, going back to 2013, that tally fluctuated between 3,448 and 15,620 deaths.

articles.title: Oxford scientist says evidence of vaccine efficacy could come in early June - Axios
articles.description: Sir John Bell is leading one of the efforts to develop a vaccine.
articles.content:
Oxford University scientist John Bell, who is leading one of the efforts to develop a coronavirus vaccine, said on NBC's "Meet the Press" Sunday that his research group will likely get evidence on whether the vaccine has efficacy by early June.

articles.author: Margaret Fosmoe South Bend Tribune
articles.title: More than a century ago, the Spanish flu struck the South Bend area hard - South Bend Tribune
articles.description: Like now, social distancing played a role in stemming the flu's progress in 1918.
articles.content:
The term social distancing didnt exist in 1918.
But the concept did, although in a more limited form than with todays stay-at-home orders in response to the novel coronavirus.
